018package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph;
019
020import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
021import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.CLASS;
022import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.INTERFACE;
023import static javax.lang.model.element.Modifier.ABSTRACT;
024import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.NONE;
025import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.ANNOTATION;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.ENUM;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.ERROR;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.EXCEPTION;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.TYPE;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
034
035import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
036import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
037import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
038import javax.lang.model.element.NestingKind;
039import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
040import javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement;
041import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
042import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
043import javax.lang.model.util.Types;
044import java.util.EnumSet;
045import java.util.HashSet;
046import java.util.List;
047import java.util.Set;
048
049import org.apiguardian.api.API;
050import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
051import org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.SVGSymbol;
052import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils;
053
054/**
055 *  The wrapper for a
056 *  {@link TypeElement}
057 *  instance, enhanced by information needed for the creation of the UML graph.
058 *
059 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
060 *  @version $Id: UMLTypeElement.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $
061 *  @since 0.0.5
062 *
063 *  @UMLGraph.link
064 */
065@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: UMLTypeElement.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $" )
066@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5")
067public final class UMLTypeElement extends UMLElement implements TypeElement
068{
069        /*-----------*\
070    ====** Constants **========================================================
071        \*-----------*/
072    /**
073     *  An empty array of {@code UMLTypeElement} objects.
074     */
075    public static final UMLTypeElement [] EMPTY_UMLTypeElement_ARRAY = new UMLTypeElement [0];
076
077        /*------------*\
078    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
079        \*------------*/
080    /**
081     *  The types that extends this class or implements this interface.
082     */
083    private final Set<UMLTypeElement> m_ChildTypes = new HashSet<>();
084
085    /**
086     *  Flag that indicates whether this type element is included somehow in
087     *  the output of this run of JavaDoc.
088     */
089    private final boolean m_IsIncludedInOutput;
090
091    /**
092     *  The type utilities that are used by this type element to configure the
093     *  output.
094     */
095    private final Types m_TypeUtils;
096
097    /**
098     *  The wrapped type element.
099     */
100    private final TypeElement m_Wrapped;
101
102        /*--------------*\
103    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
104        \*--------------*/
105    /**
106     *  Creates a new {@code UMLTypeElement} instance.
107     *
108     *  @param  element The wrapped type element.
109     *  @param  isIncluded  {@code true} if this type element is included
110     *      somehow in the output of this run of JavaDoc, {@code false}
111     *      otherwise.
112     *  @param  typeUtils   The type utilities.
113     */
114    public UMLTypeElement( final TypeElement element, final boolean isIncluded, final Types typeUtils )
115    {
116        super( element );
117        m_Wrapped = element; // Null check is done by super constructor.
118        m_IsIncludedInOutput = isIncluded;
119        m_TypeUtils = requireNonNullArgument( typeUtils, "typeUtils" );
120    }   //  UMLTypeElement()
121
122        /*---------*\
123    ====** Methods **==========================================================
124        \*---------*/
125    /**
126     *  Adds a type that extends or implements this one.
127     *
128     *  @param  child   The
129     *      {@link UMLTypeElement}
130     *      instance for the child type.
131     */
132    public final void addChildType( final UMLTypeElement child ) { m_ChildTypes.add( requireNonNullArgument( child, "child" ) ); }
133
134    /**
135     *  Creates the SVG symbol that represents this type element for the UML
136     *  diagram.
137     *
138     *  @param  layout    The instance of
139     *      {@link UMLGraphLayout}
140     *      that is used to render the document that finally contains the
141     *      {@link SVGSymbol}
142     *      instance that is created by this method.
143     *  @param  details The level of detail to show:<ul>
144     *      <li>0: no details, only class name and package name; for an enum
145     *      also the enum constants</li>
146     *      <li>1: only elements should be shown that are relevant for the
147     *      API</li>
148     *      <li>2: all elements should be shown.</li></ul>
149     *  @param  isFocusClass    {@code true} if this class is the focus
150     *      class of the graph.
151     *  @return The SVG symbol instance that represents the UML diagram for
152     *      this class.
153     */
154    public final TypeSymbol createSymbol( final UMLGraphLayout layout, final int details, final boolean isFocusClass )
155    {
156        //---* Analyse the arguments *-----------------------------------------
157        final var apiOnly = (details <= 1) || !m_IsIncludedInOutput;
158
159        //---* Render the class *----------------------------------------------
160        final var retValue = new TypeSymbol( layout.getDocument(), this, isFocusClass, apiOnly, m_IsIncludedInOutput );
161
162        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
163        return retValue;
164    }   //  createSymbol()
165
166    /**
167     *  Determines the stereotypes for this UML class doc. It will be inferred
168     *  from the type of the class. The stereotype
169     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#INTERFACE «Interface»}
170     *  is used for an interface,
171     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#ENUM «Enum»}
172     *  for an {@code enum} type, and
173     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#ANNOTATION «Annotation»}
174     *  for an annotation.<br>
175     *  <br>A <i>regular</i> class that is derived from
176     *  {@link Error}
177     *  will have the stereotype
178     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#ERROR «Error»},
179     *  or
180     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#EXCEPTION «Exception»}
181     *  if derived from
182     *  {@link Exception}.<br>
183     *  <br>An abstract class will have the stereotype
184     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#TYPE «Type»},
185     *  a class with only static methods (or no methods at all) the stereotype
186     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#UTILITY «Utility»}.<br>
187     *  <br>If none of the conditions above will fit, we have a simple class
188     *  without a particular stereotype.
189     *
190     *  @return The list of stereotypes defined for this UML type element; it
191     *      may be empty, but will never be {@code null}.
192     */
193    final String [] determineStereotypes()
194    {
195        //---* Determine the stereotype *----------------------------------
196        final Set<Stereotype> stereotype = EnumSet.noneOf( Stereotype.class );
197        KindSwitch:
198        switch( m_Wrapped.getKind() )
199        {
200            case ANNOTATION_TYPE -> stereotype.add( ANNOTATION );
201            case ENUM -> stereotype.add( ENUM );
202            case INTERFACE -> stereotype.add( Stereotype.INTERFACE );
203            //$CASES-OMITTED$
204            default ->
205            {
206                stereotype.add( Stereotype.CLASS );
207                if( getModifiers().contains( ABSTRACT ) )
208                {
209                    stereotype.add( TYPE );
210                }
211                else
212                {
213                    var superclass = getSuperclass();
214                    Element element;
215                    while( !(isNull( superclass ) || (superclass.getKind() == NONE)) )
216                    {
217                        if( "java.lang.Exception".equals( superclass.toString() ) )
218                        {
219                            stereotype.add( EXCEPTION );
220                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
221                            superclass = null;
222                            continue;
223                        }
224
225                        if( "java.lang.Error".equals( superclass.toString() ) )
226                        {
227                            stereotype.add( ERROR );
228                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
229                            superclass = null;
230                            continue;
231                        }
232
233                        element = m_TypeUtils.asElement( superclass );
234                        if( nonNull( element ) )
235                        {
236                            superclass = ((TypeElement) element).getSuperclass();
237                        }
238                        else
239                        {
240                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
241                            superclass = null;
242                        }
243                    }
244                }
245            }
246        }   //  KindSwitch:
247
248        final var retValue = stereotype.stream()
249            .map( Stereotype::toString )
250            .filter( StringUtils::isNotEmpty )
251            .toArray( String []::new );
252
253        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
254        return retValue;
255    }   //  determineStereotypes()
256
257    /**
258     *  {@inheritDoc}
259     */
260    @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" )
261    @Override
262    public final boolean equals( final Object obj )
263    {
264        var retValue = this == obj;
265        if( !retValue && (obj instanceof UMLTypeElement other ) )
266        {
267            retValue = getQualifiedName().equals( other.getQualifiedName() );
268        }
269
270        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
271        return retValue;
272    }   //  equals()
273
274    /**
275     *  Returns a list with the attributes for this type. Enum constants will
276     *  be ignored.
277     *
278     *  @param  apiOnly Flag that indicates that only attributes that are
279     *      relevant for the API will be returned.
280     *  @return The attributes; the list can be empty if the type is an
281     *      interface or there is no relevant field.
282     */
283    final List<UMLVariableElement> getAttributes( final boolean apiOnly )
284    {
285        final var retValue = getEnclosedElements().stream()
286            .filter( UMLElement::isAttribute )
287            .filter( e -> !apiOnly || isAPI( e ) )
288            .map( e -> (VariableElement) e )
289            .map( UMLVariableElement::new )
290            .collect( toList() );
291
292        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
293        return retValue;
294    }   //  getAttributes()
295
296    /**
297     *  Returns the children of this type. These are the types that implements
298     *  or extends it.
299     *
300     *  @return The children.
301     *
302     *  @see #addChildType(UMLTypeElement)
303     */
304    public final UMLTypeElement [] getChildTypes() { return m_ChildTypes.toArray( EMPTY_UMLTypeElement_ARRAY ); }
305
306    /**
307     *  Returns a list with the constructors for this type.
308     *
309     *  @param  apiOnly Flag that indicates that only constructors that are
310     *      relevant for the API will be returned.
311     *  @return The constructors; the list can be empty if the type is an
312     *      interface or there is no relevant constructor.
313     */
314    public final List<UMLConstructorElement> getConstructors( final boolean apiOnly )
315    {
316        final var retValue = getEnclosedElements().stream()
317            .filter( UMLElement::isConstructor )
318            .filter( e -> !apiOnly || isAPI( e ) )
319            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
320            .map( UMLConstructorElement::new )
321            .collect( toList() );
322
323        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
324        return retValue;
325    }   //  getConstructors()
326
327    /**
328     *  {@inheritDoc}
329     */
330    @Override
331    public final List<? extends TypeMirror> getInterfaces() { return m_Wrapped.getInterfaces(); }
332
333    /**
334     *  Returns a list with the methods for this type.
335     *
336     *  @param  apiOnly Flag that indicates that only methods that are
337     *      relevant for the API will be returned.
338     *  @return The methods; the list can be empty if there is no relevant
339     *      method.
340     */
341    public final List<UMLMethodElement> getMethods( final boolean apiOnly )
342    {
343        final var retValue = getEnclosedElements().stream()
344            .filter( UMLElement::isMethod )
345            .filter( e -> !apiOnly || isAPI( e ) )
346            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
347            .map( UMLMethodElement::new )
348            .collect( toList() );
349
350        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
351        return retValue;
352    }   //  getMethods()
353
354    /**
355     *  {@inheritDoc}
356     */
357    @Override
358    public final NestingKind getNestingKind() { return m_Wrapped.getNestingKind(); }
359
360    /**
361     *  {@inheritDoc}
362     */
363    @Override
364    public final Name getQualifiedName() { return m_Wrapped.getQualifiedName(); }
365
366    /**
367     *  {@inheritDoc}
368     */
369    @Override
370    public final TypeMirror getSuperclass() { return m_Wrapped.getSuperclass(); }
371
372    /**
373     *  {@inheritDoc}
374     */
375    @Override
376    public final List<? extends TypeParameterElement> getTypeParameters() { return m_Wrapped.getTypeParameters(); }
377
378    /**
379     *  {@inheritDoc}
380     */
381    @Override
382    public final int hashCode() { return getQualifiedName().toString().hashCode(); }
383
384    /**
385     *  Returns {@code true} if this type is abstract, either an abstract class
386     *  or an interface.
387     *
388     *  @return {@code true} if this type is abstract.
389     */
390    public final boolean isAbstract() { return isInterface() || getModifiers().contains( ABSTRACT ); }
391
392    /**
393     *  Returns {@code true} if this type element represents a class. Different
394     *  from
395     *  {@link javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#isClass()},
396     *  this method will return {@code false} if this type element is an
397     *  {@code enum}.
398     *
399     *  @return {@code true} if this type element represents a class.
400     */
401    public final boolean isClass() { return getKind() == CLASS; }
402
403    /**
404     *  Returns {@code true} if this type represents an interface. Different
405     *  from
406     *  {@link javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#isInterface()},
407     *  this method will return {@code false} if this type element is an
408     *  {@code annotation}.
409     *
410     *  @return {@code true} if this type represents an interface.
411     */
412    public final boolean isInterface() { return getKind() == INTERFACE; }
413}
414//  class UMLTypeElement
415
416/*
417 *  End of File
418 */
